fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to generate new language pack for our native language. I prepared ANT configuration, as well as language settings which I taken from your new language generation reference. MySQL lang settings was set it latin5 (iso-8859-9), also database created with latin5. So, you can find following step by step process.

STEP BY STEP WHAT I DID :

1. Confluence Installation
1.a. MySQL installation (MySQL language was set to latin5)
1.b. Create MySQL database (Database was create with latin5 language - CREATE DATABASE confluence CHARACTER SET latin5 COLLATE latin5_turkish_ci)
1.c. Set Confluence MySQL JDBC connection string UTF8 to latin5 (jdbc:mysql://localhost/confluence?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=latin5)
1.d. Set Confluence Encoding UTF8 to ISO-8859-9 (by General Configuration Section)
1.e. Install Confluence Standalone (Built-in Confluence Apache Tomcat was integrate with Apache Web Server by proxy setting)
1.f. Check Confluence installation (Confluence was working properly)
1.g. Check Turkish characters (I did create one page which that page has turkish characters, there was no any problem with turkish characters on page)


2. Confluence  New Language Process
2.a. Download sample au_AU language file.
2.b. Download "EditPad Pro" (EditPad Pro supporting multi language files, especially iso-8859 encoded files)
2.c. Change EditPad Pro Language Settings (Options Menu -> Configure File Types... -> Select Text File from left listbox -> Select Encoding Tab from right side -> set "Default Text Encoding" to the ISO-8859-9)
2.d. Create a language folder into the confluence installation directory. ( D:\confluence\confluence-std-2.6.0\languages )
2.e. Copy sample au_AU language file to the related directory (which I wrote above) then change it directory name to tr_TR
2.f. Create a sample text file by EditPad Pro (text file encoding character was set it iso-8859-9 from ) then save that file with the ConfluenceActionSupport_tr_TR.properties file name into the D:\confluence\confluence-std-2.6.0\languages\tr_TR\src\etc\com\atlassian\confluence\core directory.
2.g. Change English words to Turkish words
2.h. Convert to .jar file by Apache ANT (D:\confluence\confluence-std-2.6.0\languages>ant -Dlanguage=tr_TR build)
2.i. Copy languages-tr_TR.jar file to Confluence WEB-INF\lib directory.
2.j. Restart Confluence Server


Also, if you check attached image, you will see the problem.
fields.summary: Confluence Language problem

fields.description:
Ideally, with anonymous access *disabled*, unauthenticated users are not able to get any information from Confluence(e.g. space names, pages, version).
Though, if anonymous access is disabled and an invalid URL is entered (e.g. http://<host-name>/invalidurl), a redirection happens to an error page. The error pages displays in the lower right corner, a list of space names with are visible to *ALL* users or with no permissions assigned to them (e.g. Please review the attached screenshot).

This information should not be made visible or available to unauthenticated users. Instead a check should be performed before directing the user to "Error Page" to ensure the user is authenticated, and if the user is not authenticated, then a redirection to the login page must happen.
fields.summary: Space names made visible to a non-authorised user upon entering a wrong URL

fields.description:
1. Primary Datacenter Confluence uses Database A.
2. Database A used oracle high availability dataguard to Secondary Datacenter Database B.
3. Confluence Instance in Primary Datacenter and Confluence in Secondary Datacenter are dns'd in a failover situation
4. If Primary Datacenter is lost - automatically seemlessly fails over to Secondary Confluence Instance.
5. End User see's no downtime or knows they were directed to the failover environment.

We've tested this type of setup in our development environment.

When the Secondary Confluence Instance connects to Database B it sees the connections that are created by Oracle Dataguard - user Public as a cluster and shuts down.

If there is a way to get the secondary confluence instance to connect to database B, we'd be buying another unlimited commercial license.
fields.summary: Oracle High Availability Dataguard

I would like to a request from development team. 
As you know, book publishers using "Example" directives in their books which they would like to refer some code examples. When we want to use Code Macro with Panel Macro, we might use only title over the panel.

Thanks,
Regards
Oguz Celikdemir

fields.description:
There was a bug in the Confluence 2.6.0 release process where the 2.6-dr1 source tag was hard coded resulting in the 2.6-r1 source code being shipped instead of the 2.6.0 source release.

The source release on the website has been updated with the correct release.
fields.summary: Atlassian Confluence 2.6.0-dr1 source release was shipped mistakenly with 2.6.0

fields.description:
Versions before 2.6.0 used to have a plus sign next to the link to a non-existent page 
e.g. Project Management+

In Version 2.6.0 it is just Project Management

The plus.gif is available in images/icons folder. When you view the html source in IE, the call to display the gif is missing in 2.6.0

The functionality as such works. It is the usability factor, as well as continuity of user interface. This will lead to re-educating users.
fields.summary: Link to a non-existent page does not have the + gif next to it, as it used to in the earlier versions of Confluence
When searching for page alternatives for a user who navigates to a non-existant or non-permitted page we should scope the search down to permissable spaces only

fields.description:
I received an email notification from Confluence with an unsubsituted value.
The notification was of a comment replying to another comment.
The unsubstituted value was the name of the original author.

{noformat}
In reply to a comment by $action.getUserFullName($username):
{noformat}

Possiby relevant (but probably not).  I had a watch directly on the page.  I was the author of the original comment.  The notification was for this[http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Copy+Space+Plugin?focusedCommentId=97911549#comment-97911549].
fields.summary: Notifications of replies to comments contain unsubstituted value for author of original comment

fields.description:
I've attached an image that demonstrates what imported Jira portlets end up looking like when they are subsequently exported to PDF from Confluence.  Issues include:

# Coloration is largely lost. ( remains only in images. )
# Extra wireframes appear in the PDF version
# Graph bars are all the same length.
# Graph bars are shorter than the rows that contain them.

We've seen the same behavior in several versions of PDF viewer.
fields.summary: PDF rendering of Jira Portlet from Confluence loses important formatting

fields.description:
When viewing global permissions, users are displayed as:

*User Full Name* (username)

When editing global permissions, users are displayed as:

*User Full Name*

This inconsistency makes no obvious sense.  I don't know which one is better.  My preference would be to always *only* display the username.  The Full Name seems to be unneccessary clutter on this screen.  Perhaps it could be a tooltip?
fields.summary: Usernames in View and Edit Global Permissions are inconsistently displayed

fields.description:
View, Edit, Attachments and Info tabs are a slightly different size (vertically) to Browse Space, Add Page, Add News and Add Bookmark - screenshot attached.

Also, after upgrade I regularly didn't get the tabs at all, but plain html links on a grey background. I can't reproduce this anymore, but it was a bit worrying given that it was occuring inconsistently.

fields.description:
Turning on the "Display a notification about every script error" in the Internet Explorer 6's _Tools > Internet Option > Advanced_ page would prompt a javascript error similar to the attached screenshot, {{javascript.jpg}}. The error is prompted when one is trying to search using the {{livesearch}} macro in the specific page.

This is reproducible in Internet Explorer 7.

fields.description:
Improve the Confluence Installation Guide, in particular this page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+Standalone

* Make it easier to follow.
* Clarify and rationalise the bits that are OS-specific or multi-path.
* Move the trouble-shooting bits and remove the hide/show panels.
* Add screenshots. 
* Basically, make it more friendly, so that it caters for the less technical user as well as the technical user.

Primary requester is David Soul (Mon 8 October 2007).
fields.summary: Improve the Confluence Installation  Guide

fields.description:
This problem is raised from the support issue - https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-11863

The initial problem was a failure during PDF export which looked like -

{noformat}
2007-10-03 21:26:09,006 ERROR [Export Space task] [core.task.longrunning.AbstractLongRunningTask] doInTransactionWithoutResult 
Error during export
 -- url: /spaces/doexportspace.action | userName: pcurren | action: doexportspace
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.generateXslFo(PdfExporter.java:178)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.doExportEntity(PdfExporter.java:97)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.exportSpace(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:127)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.doExport(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:109)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.doExport(PdfExporter.java:63)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.DefaultImportExportManager.exportAs(DefaultImportExportManager.java:112)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:287)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:181)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:148)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:96)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:170)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:176)
        at $Proxy49.exportAs(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.actions.ExportSpaceLongRunningTask$2.doInTransactionWithoutResult(ExportSpaceLongRunningTask.java:8
5)
        at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:33)
        at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:114)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.actions.ExportSpaceLongRunningTask.runInternal(ExportSpaceLongRunningTask.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:21)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.caucho.server.connection.AbstractHttpRequest.getContextPath(AbstractHttpRequest.java:506)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper.getContextPath(HttpServletRequestWrapper.java:108)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper.getContextPath(HttpServletRequestWrapper.java:108)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper.getContextPath(HttpServletRequestWrapper.java:108)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper.getContextPath(HttpServletRequestWrapper.java:108)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper.getContextPath(HttpServletRequestWrapper.java:108)
        at com.caucho.server.webapp.RequestDispatcherImpl.include(RequestDispatcherImpl.java:403)
        at com.caucho.server.webapp.RequestDispatcherImpl.include(RequestDispatcherImpl.java:350)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.exportResource(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:208)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.exportImages(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:151)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.generateXslFo(PdfExporter.java:174)
        ... 22 more
{noformat}

This is due to the HttpServletRequest instance being stored within the ThreadLocal and accessed by the LongRunningTask thread as it performed the export. When resin returns the HttpServletRequest to the pool some internal details are nulled (such as the context).

This was worked around by wrapping the request in a compatible class which takes a copy of the necessary data.

The ServletContextHoldingRequest also needed to be modified. It was returning an HttpSession instance anonymous class which resin was later trying to cast to it's own SessionImpl class. (ServletContextHoldingRequest was modified to hold the HttpSession instance from the real request.)

Once this was all hacked around, a new problem was being exposed -

{noformat}
2007-10-08 13:26:57,004 ERROR [Export Space task] [core.task.longrunning.AbstractLongRunningTask] doInTransactionWithoutResult Error during export
 -- url: /spaces/doexportspace.action | userName: pcurren | action: doexportspace
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Error while generating PDF!

        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.doExportEntity(PdfExporter.java:98)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.AbstractRendererExporterImpl.exportSpace(AbstractRendererExporterImpl.java:127)

        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:287)

Please refer to attached screenshot for more details.

The space activity stats in space admin should be possible to include as a macro.

Availability through remote apis (webservices, rest etc) would also be coolio.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9654].
  {panel}

Updating Confluence to use Axis2 would provide several advantages. (Currently Confluence is using Axis-1.2.1 which is becoming a bit dated)

* Axis2 is faster. I haven't done any bench marking but it's suppose to be an order of magnitude or two faster according to docs and comments.
* Development is ongoing
* The documentation is better
* The .NET compatibility is better.
* The code bindings it generates are easier to work with than Axis 1.x (personally I like the XMLBeans bindings you can now optionally generate)
* Axis2 has better memory management 

The above points mean it will generally be more productive to develop using Axis2 both in terms of providing and consuming web services.

Having more robust Confluence web services and tools for both providing and consuming external content will encouraging plugin devel.
fields.summary: upgrade the RemoteAPI to use Axis2

fields.description: Would be nice if there were some possibility to save a wiki posting while editing without leaving the editor. Typically useful when making meeting notes while others are watching the progression of the page.
fields.summary: Save without leaving editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9652].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to have clicks in the tag cloud use an AND to create complex searches.

click on the tag "Windows" get a list of pages with that tag, and a list of tags on those pages.

click on the tag "programing" and get a page with the pages that have the tags "Windows" and "Programming"

click on the tag "Java" and get a page of links that have the tags "Windows", "programming", and "Java"

this would allow a user to intelligently search content that they are not necessarily familiar with.
fields.summary: AND for tag cloud clicks

fields.description:
It's easy to view an old version of a page, but it would be useful if that page could link to similarly old version of other pages too.

This would be useful when it's desirable to view a snapshot of the space from some time ago. For example if the space documents a product design where older versions will not be updated, but you still might want to view how something worked in a older version. Having this feature would remove the need to export the entire space and save it separately for every snapshot.

One implementation would be to support a request something like "viewpage.action?space=mywiki&pagename=widgets&by_date=20061001" which would return the page as it looked on or before October 1st, 2006. This would be very similar to the current historical view. However each page would like to other pages in the same space using the same by_date parameter.
fields.summary: View old version of space / View page/space by date

fields.description:
I've often ended up coding:
h2.See Also
* [Some Page] --- {excerpt-include:Some Page|nopanel=true}

But when that page name changes the link gets updated but not the excerpt. If it could be something like this instead that'd be nice:
* [Some Page|include-excerpt]
fields.summary: Have excerpt option on link

fields.description:
Settings in Global Bandana (eg. user macros and some of our own plugins that store data there) don't seem to be backed up properly.

Due to serious "anonymous creator" bug on 2.6.0 we've rolled back to 2.6-dr1 to continue our confluence 2.6.x testing. I'm not sure if the bandana backup bug is present in 2.6.0 or not.

Steps to reproduce...

# Store something in global bandana.
# Take full confluence backup via web ui
# Restore in to new instance somewhere
# Global bandana stuff missing

Luckily we build backup/restore UI in to our main plugins so that the data in them can be backed-up and restored independently of Confluence. However, I've not see any other third party plugins that do this so any storing their data in global bandana, well, ticking time bomb...
fields.summary: Global Bandana not getting backed-up or restored - Conf 2.6-dr1

fields.description:
Inserting a link to an attachment fails in WYSIWYG mode under the following circumstances: Page created using {html} plugin, that refers to an attached stylesheet. If a user is in WYSIWYG mode and using Internet Explorer 6 or 7, presses the "link" icon, and selects an attached file to link to, the following link is placed: "http://(server):8080/pages/#" which is a link referring to a dead page. In IE 6 or 7
  • ^IMG_5370.jpg
    • However, if a user does the same within Firefox, the correct attachment link is placed: "/download/attachments/4063663/IMG_5370.jpg?version=1". In Firefox v.2.0.0.7
  • IMG_5370.jpg
fields.summary: Inserting a link in WYSIWYG mode fails if within {html} plugin and user is using Internet Explorer 6 or 7

fields.description:
http://www.sitemaps.org/protocol.php

Sitemaps allow search engines to quickly index all of one's content, and also to figure out what content needs to be re-indexed.  Many wiki's such as MediaWiki support this feature, and search engines like Google look for and use it.  If you add or change a page, it allows a search engine to quickly index just the page which changed, and the engine does not have to crawl your entire site.  

This would be a great feature to have for both Confluence & JIRA.
fields.summary: Automatically create sitemaps for JIRA/Confluence

fields.description:
There is a bug in the version of Velocity that Confluence is currently using such that it will actually set the value of the variable to the last non-null value of the variable if you try to set the variable to null. This is especially nasty when you are doing things in a loop in a velocity template within Confluence. This bit us and could end up biting a good number of people.

How this bug affects Confluence users is described here:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9457 (was closed as "won't fix" since it is a velocity bug and not a Confluence bug)

The description of the Velocity bug with sample code is here:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-186

Matt said that upgrading to Velocity 1.5 would fix this.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence's Velocity dependency to 1.5
Attachment macro should allow filtering by labels

fields.description:
Toward the end of September 2007 the plugin repository started failing with a 502 error (see attachment), which continued for a couple of weeks before I got a resolution.  According to a post on the mailing list the cause was that one of Atlassian's servers had changed IP address, and restarting Confluence made it pick up the new address.

So that means Confluence is caching the results of the DNS lookup beyond the TTL expiry.  Please could this be fixed so future IP address changes don't break Confluence again?
fields.summary: Confluence caches DNS lookups for too long

fields.description: With lengthy documentation it may be difficult for an user to see the information they searched for after going to a result document. It would be good to highlight the search terms for the active search in the document, similar to Google's cached search results or the various search engine toolbars.
fields.summary: Highlight search terms when viewing result pages
Nonsense

fields.description:
Velocity should automatically escape (encode) HTML entities in variables it interpolates in markup. This would remove the need for explicitly escaping variables using $generalUtil.htmlEncode, and fix lots of XSS bugs including ones we haven't discovered yet.

This affects all versions of Confluence.
fields.summary: Velocity does not automatically escape HTML entities when substituting variables

fields.description:
Explicit log statements at the start and end of jobs are the reason why we ended up with the haphazard logging to be fixed with CONF-9447.

We should fix this properly by wrapping the job beans in a logging interceptor that logs the start and end of the job. There should be ample examples on the web of how to do this with Spring. Our transaction proxy configuration or Bandana transactional cache logging advice might also be useful examples.
fields.summary: Logging of job-progress should be done with an aspect or wrapper

form#quickSearch {

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-9624].
  {panel}

It would be great if there was a "Dynamic User Group" plugin component type. While I'm sure this sort of thing could be done with Crowd, many clients are using other SSO and LDAP systems which are difficult to cater for from within Confluence.

The plugin component would be used to create "fake" user groups within Confluence. To the rest of Confluence, they would appear like normal local groups, you could even add users to them (although it would be up to the plugin to decide what to do in this case).

Some examples:

1. Intersection Groups

The plugin config would allow an admin to define any number of intersection groups - each intersection group would list users that appear in two or more specific groups.

For example, let's say I have groups for job roles and countries. An intersection group could be made to collate all users who are both in Sweeden and are also Principle Engineers.

2. Privilege Groups

You could create a group that would list all space administrators.

3. Top Contributors Group

A group to list 50 of the most prolific contributors in Confluence.

4. Email Groups

A group to collate all people with a specific domain in their email address. This is really useful in cases where Confluence is used as an extranet as it would make collating everyone from company X in to a group simply by their email address.

In terms of social networking, etc., the Dynamic User Group component would be extremely useful.

EDIT: The dynamic groups would ideally have a flag to distinguish them from normal groups (in case any plugins or other functionality needs to know the difference).
fields.summary: Dynamic User Group plugins

fields.description:
Confluence style links are rendered as relative URLs (eg. /display/TEST/Foo) in the content of an RSS feed. This causes those links to point to the wrong URL in some readers. In [Brief|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/4578], for example, the URL is assumed to be relative to "file://". Therefore, all page links in the article are broken.

Confluence should include the fully qualified domain name of the server so that links will be clickable in feed readers.
fields.summary: Confluence links are not fully qualified in RSS content

fields.description: JTA dependency in Confluence 2.6.0 requires JTA to be installed in local repository - didn't before. I understand the licensing issues, but since this worked when building Confluence plugins in Maven 2 against Confluence 2.5.3 as a dependency and doesn't work when Confluence 2.6.0 is a dependency, this might be considered a bug or at least an annoyance.
fields.summary: JTA dependency in Confluence 2.6.0 requires JTA to be installed in local repository - didn't before

fields.description:
If you try to build any confluence plugin in maven 2 against confluence 2.6.0 as a dependency it claims that ofbcore-entity is not available (because the version it is looking for is not available via repository.atlassian.com.

To "fix" this currently a confluence plugin can build against confluence 2.6.0 as a dependency by adding:

        <dependency>
           <groupId>ofbcore</groupId>
           <artifactId>ofbcore-entity</artifactId>
           <version>2.1.1-atlassian-16Oct06</version>
           <scope>provided</scope>
       </dependency>

to the pom.xml since that version of ofbcore-entity IS available via repository.atlassian.com, even though it was not the one that confluence 2.6.0 was built against as it is a different version.

It appears though if you build a confluence plugin against that entity ofbcore version and confluence version 2.5.3 as a dependency (to try to make the plugin compatible with 2.5.x and 2.6.x) that does not work. I think that we will end up having to have a version of our Custom Space User Management plugin for 2.3.x-2.5.x and another one for 2.6.x-(until the next major API change like this).
fields.summary: ofbcore-entity dependency missing from Atlassian Maven repository

fields.description:
When rendering a calendar in Confluence v2.6, the calendar is not rendered correctly.
There is a wheel spinning continuously towards the top, next to the "Time-Zone" link as well as next to the "Add a Calendar" link. The wheel keeps spinning till the time the page is open in the "View" mode.
Additionally, the indentation and alignment of the calendar is inappropriate as the Calendar extends from left to right across the page and covers the entire screen, with the actual calendar aligned towards the left of the screen and a blank panel towards its right.
There are no errors in the logs.
Tested and reproduced this on IE and FireFox.
Please review the attached screenshots for more details.
fields.summary: Calendar not being rendered correctly

fields.description: Confluence currently still has the old individual Action.properties files for i18n. Most of the properties have been moved to CAS.properties and there are quite a few empty properties files that could be clean up.
fields.summary: Remove empty *Action.properties files

fields.description:
When I try creating a space where the space key has a hypen (eg. "foo-bar") instead of getting a friendly "invalid character" message I get a whopping great exception.

It would be nice if:

a) I got a more friendly error message

and

b) If you showed illegal (or inversely, allowed) chars below the space key field so that users know in advance what cannot or can be used.
fields.summary: Space key with "-" (hyphen) thows exception

fields.description: Some plugins were written to use the "log" member variable to log with in subclasses of ConfluenceActionSupport. This member was either renamed or the access level was changed as part of the changes between 2.5.7 and 2.6.0. This broke the Custom Space User Management plugin. Log attached. I will change the plugin to add a different log member to attempt to get this working again.

fields.description:
In Confluence 2.2.* (screenshot is of 2.2.8) there was a Recently Edited list on every User's Profile. On that i could easily see whether the user has done something (maybe i could make a suggestion whether he has just edited his name or is a power user). I liked that feature. 

*Please put it back into a current/future Confluence version if possible.*

Is there any Reason why it was removed?

Update the {page-info} macro example used in the Confluence's Notation Guide

fields.description:
Append an "Average Time in Status" portlet's URL to the {{jiraportlet}} macro in a Confluence's page does not return any output to the page (empty content). Accessing the portlet's URL via the browser directly returned the expected result instead.
Other charts' portlet rendered the expected result on the Confluence's page when using the {{jiraportlet}} macro. such as the "Pie Chart" portlet.
fields.summary: JIRA's "Average Time in Status" portlet returns empty result in a jiraportlet macro

fields.description:
When a group is titled with a # sign in the beginning of the name, the # sign is not correctly converted to %23 when passed as a parameter. 

To replicate:
1) Create a group with the name #xxx
2) Add 11 users to the group (more than 10)
3) Go to Administration -> Manage Groups
4) Click on the second page of the group. The URL will have a # instead of %23. For example:
http://localhost:8081/admin/users/domembersofgroupsearch.action?membersOfGroupTerm=#HX%20Exampt&startIndex=10

Which should be:
http://localhost:8081/admin/users/domembersofgroupsearch.action?membersOfGroupTerm=%23HX%20Exampt&startIndex=10
fields.summary: Group browser does not render pound sign # when passing group name as a parameter in domembersofgroupsearch.action?membersOfGroupTerm=

fields.description:
See the method that David Peterson wrote here to workaround this issue:

http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/browse/public/contrib/confluence/webdav-plugin/trunk/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/extra/webdav/impl/resource/PagePdfDocResource.java?r1=9448&r2=10269

Instead of this workaround, wouldn't it be better to support use of the old exportAs and importAs methods of com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportManager and at most just deprecate those methods?

My team is currently writing a bulk import/export spaces plugin that we're going to provide free to the confluence community, and would rather use the API directly instead of via reflection hack if possible.

(Note: this deals with both import and export, I think. I haven't seen the 2.6 API docs yet)
fields.summary: Confluence 2.6 API changed ImportExportManager method signature(s) without deprecating old one(s)

fields.description: Would be very helpful to have 2.6 API docs, even if only snapshot.
fields.summary: Please add 2.6 API docs to http://docs.atlassian.com/com/atlassian/confluence/atlassian-confluence/

fields.description:
We need to improve the performance & quality of Confluence. 

From a quick glance at an installation on Oracle 

select count(*) from user_indexes where  table_name='CONTENT' it appears that we only create two indices on the CONTENT table!

This is not optimal - we cater for around 5 content types in the content table (at least) so something is running more slowly than it should. 

Confirm if this is accurate. Plan indexing on CONTENT (and other central tables) to improve performance.
fields.summary: CLONE -investigate current indexes created on content table in Confluence

fields.description:
We should provide more examples in the standard installation of Confluence. Currently we have a only one (pretty ugly) demonstration space. It would make sense to create a few new example projects: 

* A XP-development project
* a Scrum-development project,
* a documentation project
* a professional services project, 
* a product launch project
* a sales space
* a company knowledge base

 etc etc etc
fields.summary: Add sensible demo spaces to Confluence packaged project

fields.description:
Trying to track down an issue in the upgrade of Subconf to conf 2.6, I saw that ConfluenceEntityObject.log is declared as

protected final Logger log = Logger.getLogger(getClass());

i.e. not static

I don't have the source yet for 2.6 so couldn't see if this was deliberate, but it stuffs me trying to use XStream as a neat easy way to serialise objects because
1. XStream now tries to serialize this object, which spews heaps of xml and an exception when you try to deserialize
and
2. the version of XStream in conf 2.6 doesnt have the XStream.omitField method

Also aren't there performance implications of creating a log for every entity object?

If this is deliberate, shouldn't the field be marked as transient?
fields.summary: ConfluenceEntityObject.log is not static?

fields.summary: Conf 2.6 with scaffolding doesn't allow saving or editing of pages

fields.description: Confluence ran out of memory last night and crashed.  We have a heap of 768MB which I believe is too small, we will be increasing it to 1.8GB.  Do you know of any instability of Confluence 2.3.3 on WAS 6.0.2.17 with JDK 1.4.2 on AIX 5.3?
fields.summary: Confluence crashes suddenly on WAS

fields.description:
This bug is reproduced on 1024x768 screen resolution 

Steps to reproduce:
1. Login to Confluence, go to Dashboard
2. click on Browse Space.
3. choose Space Admin.
4. in Look and Feel group click on Layout.
5. choose "Create custom"  in "Operations"
fields.summary: Tabs are broken on "Create custom decorator page"

fields.description:
with v2.2.10 clicking on the Logo in the top left corner would take you to the "Site homepage"
* this was great as we set up a whole menu system for the entire confluence site on this page.

However - with the new version 2.5.7 clicking on the Logo takes you to the SPACE homepage and not the site homepage.
* so whatever space you are currently in - you will only go to the root of that space.

*I would like to request that this is an option that the admin can select - how they want confluence to respond when the site logo is clicked.*
(I would prefer site homepage over space homepage)
fields.summary: Admin to select if logo click goes to SITE homepage or SPACE homepage.
